* The {@code AlphaException} class represents a custom exception specific to the Alpha application.
* This exception is thrown when a particular error condition is encountered in the application.
/** A detailed description of the exception. */
* Constructs a new {@code AlphaException} with the specified detail message.
* @param description the detail message that explains the reason for the exception
* Returns the description of this exception.
* @return the detail message string of this {@code AlphaException} instance
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate by, boolean isDone) {
public Event(String description, LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
public Event(String description, LocalDate start, LocalDate end, boolean isDone) {
* The {@code Task} class represents a task with a description and a completion status.
/** The completion status of the task. */
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* Constructs a new {@code Task} with the specified description and completion status.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param isDone the completion status of the task
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done or not.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" if the task is not done
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a formatted string representing the task in storage format.
* @return a string in the format "| doneStatus | description"
* Returns a formatted date string for printing purposes.
* @return a formatted date string in the "MMM d yyyy" pattern
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status and description.
* @return a string representation of the task
* The {@code Parser} class provides utility methods to extract different parts of a user's input.
* Extracts the command part of the input string.
* @param input the input string containing a command followed by other details
* @return the command part of the input string
* Extracts the description part of the input string, which is before the first '/'.
* @param input the input string containing a description and date details
* @return the description part of the input string
* Extracts the first date part of the input string, which is after the first '/'.
* @param input the input string containing a description and date details
*              the date is prefixed by 'by' or 'from'
* @return the first date part of the input string
* Extracts the second date part of the input string, which is after the second '/'.
* @param input the input string containing a date prefixed by 'to'
* @return the second date part of the input string
* The {@code Storage} class handles the creation, reading, writing,
* and synchronization of task data to a file.
/** The file path where the task data is stored. */
* Constructs a {@code Storage} object with the specified file path.
* @param FilePath the path to the file where task data will be stored
* Creates a new file if it does not already exist.
* If the file already exists, no action is taken.
* Writes the specified text to the file.
* If the file does not exist, it is created.
* @param textToAdd the text to write to the file
* Loads tasks from the file and returns them as an {@code ArrayList} of {@code Task} objects.
* If the file is not found, an empty list is returned.
* @return an {@code ArrayList} of tasks loaded from the file
* Synchronizes the task list with the file by writing the updated list to the file.
* @param TaskLists an {@code ArrayList} of tasks to be synchronized with the file
* The {@code TaskList} class manages a list of tasks, providing functionality to
* store, modify, delete, and retrieve tasks.
/** The list of tasks managed by this {@code TaskList}. */
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} object with the specified list of tasks.
* @param TaskLists the initial list of tasks
* @throws AlphaException if the provided list of tasks is empty
* Stores a new task in the list.
* @param newTask the task to be added to the list
* Returns the last task in the list unless the task's description is "bye".
* @return the last task in the list or {@code null} if the list is empty or the last task's description is "bye"
* Returns a string representing all tasks in the list, each numbered sequentially.
* @return a formatted string of all tasks in the list
* Modifies the completion status of the task at the specified index.
* @param index the position of the task in the list (1-based index)
* @param markStatus {@code true} to mark the task as done, {@code false} to mark it as undone
* @return a string representing the modified task
public String modifyOperation(int index, boolean markStatus) {
* Deletes the task at the specified index from the list.
* @param index the position of the task in the list (1-based index)
* @return a string representing the deleted task
* Returns a string indicating the number of tasks currently in the list.
* @return a formatted string showing the current number of tasks
return "Now you have " + String.valueOf(this.TaskLists.size()) + " tasks in the list.";
* Returns the list of tasks managed by this {@code TaskList}.
* The {@code Ui} class handles the user interface messages, displaying
* various responses to the user based on their interactions with the application.
* Displays the welcome message to the user when the application starts.
* Displays the list of tasks currently stored in the {@code TaskList}.
* @param taskList the {@code TaskList} containing the tasks to be displayed
+ "Here are the tasks in your list:\n"
* Displays an error message indicating that no tasks were loaded from memory.
* Displays a farewell message to the user when they exit the application.
+ "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!" + "\n"
* Displays a message confirming that a new task has been added to the {@code TaskList}.
* @param taskList the {@code TaskList} containing the newly added task
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param modifiedRecord a string representing the task that was marked as not done
+ "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n "
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been marked as done.
* @param modifiedRecord a string representing the task that was marked as done
+ "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
